channel.title: Port Forwarding with a Belkin Router?
channel.description: Welcome, I have a very troubling question (for me anyways). We just moved and we dumped linksys and got a belkin router. Well, i do not know how to do it at all. I got all the way up to virtual servers...then im stumped. can someone post a pic showing me how to do it or type it out. thanks!

item.title: Port Forwarding with a Belkin Router?
item.dc:creator: @tehlobbiescape tehlobbiescape
item.description:
@tehlobbiescape wrote:

Sorry your stuck at this step too. it took me like 5 days of strait working to portfoward my belkin router,

Okay well, Type in your default gateway which you find in CMD by running as administrator and typing in ipconfig /all
in the adress bar in your favorate web browser. You will then go to virtual servers, and set it up.
then change your dynamic ip to static ip. (you can do that on your routers site) thats what your on right now. once you do that you should be done, good luck!

Read full topic
item.source: Port Forwarding with a Belkin Router?

item.title: Port Forwarding with a Belkin Router?
item.dc:creator: @alexplt178 alexplt178
item.description:
@alexplt178 wrote:

go run in start menu then type cmd. After you get to command prompt type ipconfig. look for wirless network or w.e. type the ip adress on your browser. once you get there look for somthing in the lines to game port or forwarding. after that go to the part that says port and type in start 43594 and in end 43594. if theres a white box near the wanted forward click it to check mark if not then your good.

READ: to login try the user names: Admin, Belkin, Network (password admin), admin (pass network)

Read full topic
item.source: Port Forwarding with a Belkin Router?
